Document.name: Document
Document.description:
All data stored by Visual Novel Maker follows the document-format except graphic- and audio resources. All documents
can be found in data-folder of the project. Each document is stored as .json file using its own unique identifier (UID) as
file name.

SceneDocument.name: SceneDocument
SceneDocument.description: Stores the data of a scene.

DataRecordDocument.name: DataRecordDocument
DataRecordDocument.description: Stores the data record of the database.

CharacterDataRecordDocument.name: CharacterDataRecordDocument
CharacterDataRecordDocument.description: Stores the data record of the database.

CharacterExpressionDataRecordDocument.name: CharacterExpressionDataRecordDocument
CharacterExpressionDataRecordDocument.description: Stores the character expressions defined in database.

CGGalleryDataRecordDocument.name: CGGalleryDataRecordDocument
CGGalleryDataRecordDocument.description: Stores the CG Gallery defined in database.

AnimationDataRecordDocument.name: AnimationDataRecordDocument
AnimationDataRecordDocument.description: Stores an animation defined in database.

CommonEventDataRecordDocument.name: CommonEventDataRecordDocument
CommonEventDataRecordDocument.description: Stores a common-event defined in database.

SystemDataRecordDocument.name: SystemDataRecordDocument
SystemDataRecordDocument.description: Stores the system record defined in database.

CommonEventParameter.name: CommonEventParameter
CommonEventParameter.description: Stores a single common event parameter definition.

CommonEventParameterNumberList.name: CommonEventParameterNumberList
CommonEventParameterNumberList.description: Stores the number-list of a common event parameter.

CommonEventParameterNumberListEntry.name: CommonEventParameterNumberListEntry
CommonEventParameterNumberListEntry.description: Stores the number-list entry of a common event parameter's number list.

CGGalleryRelationData.name: CGGalleryRelationData
CGGalleryRelationData.description: Stores the relation-data of a CG Gallery entry.

DocumentLink.name: DocumentLink
DocumentLink.description: Describes a link to a document. A document link also be just a string if no additional data is needed.

ResourceWrapper.name: ResourceWrapper
ResourceWrapper.description:
A wrapper which contains the actual resource-definition in its resource-property. This wrapper exists
for interal technical reasons.

Resource.name: Resource
Resource.description: Describes a graphic or audio resource.

GraphicResource.name: GraphicResource
GraphicResource.description: Describes a graphic or audio resource.

AudioResource.name: AudioResource
AudioResource.description: Describes a graphic or audio resource.

LocalizableStringLink.name: LocalizableStringLink
LocalizableStringLink.description: Describes a link to a localizable string.

classitems.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the document. This ID must also be used as the name for the .json file.
classitems.name: uid

classitems.description: Timestamp of the document's last modification. Its always zero and only present for internal reasons.
classitems.name: lastModificationTime

classitems.description: Contains the actual data of the document. It is important to keep the data in a serializable/deserializable state.
classitems.name: items

classitems.description: The document's display name.
classitems.name: items.name

classitems.description:
The document's type. That field is necessary because Visual Novel Maker needs to know what how to handle this document. The following public document types are available:

  • vn.scene
    • - Scene
  • vn.chapter
    • - Chapter
  • data_record
    • - Database Record
  • game_script
    • - Game Script in Script-Editor
  • script
    • - Script in Extension Editor
  • event_command
    • - Scene Command for Scene-Editor/View
  • DataRecordView
    • - Database Category + View.
  • custom_view
    • - Custom View/Form for use in other views/forms/scene-commands.
  • application_language_bundle
    • - Language Bundle to translate custom plugins into different languages.
  • language_profile
    • - Language Profile definition for the game's supported languages.
  • language_bundle
    • - Language Bundle which contains all texts of a game language.
  • custom_strings_bundle
    • - Contains localized custom texts for use in game scripts.
  • global_variables
    • - Stores all global variable definitions.
  • persistent_variables
    • - Stores all persistent variable definitions.
  • settings
    • - Stores project specific settings
  • extension
    • - Holds data about an installed plugin.
classitems.name: items.type

classitems.description: Contains all commands of the scene.
classitems.name: items.commands

classitems.description: UID of the scene's parent-document. That can be another scene or the chapter.
classitems.name: items.parentId

classitems.description: UID of the chapter the scene is associated to.
classitems.name: items.chapterUid

classitems.description: The order-index to control sorting of scenes in editor.
classitems.name: items.order

classitems.description:
Contains all texts used in the scene which can be translated through language configuration view/editor. See
LocalizableString documentation.
classitems.name: items.localizableStrings

classitems.description: Stores all local number variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.numberVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local string variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.stringVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local boolean variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.booleanVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local list variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.listVariables

classitems.description: Database category the data record belongs to.
classitems.name: items.category

classitems.description: ID of the data record which matches with the data.index.
classitems.name: items.id

classitems.description: Contains actual data of the record.
classitems.name: items.data

classitems.description: Name of the data-record used in-game.
classitems.name: items.data.name

classitems.description: Index of the data-record in database used in-game. Starts with 0. So 0 = Record 0001, 1 = Record 0002, etc.
classitems.name: items.data.index

classitems.description: Indiciates if the data record is a folder.
classitems.name: items.isFolder

classitems.description:
Contains all texts used in the scene which can be translated through language configuration view/editor. See
LocalizableString documentation.
classitems.name: items.localizableStrings

classitems.description: UID of the data-record's parent-document. That can be data-record configured as folder or null if its a top-level data record.
classitems.name: items.parentId

classitems.description: Stores all local number variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.data.numberVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local string variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.data.stringVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local boolean variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.data.booleanVariables

classitems.description: Stores all local list variable definitions by index.
classitems.name: items.data.listVariables

classitems.description: Stores the character's color used for messages in NVL mode.
classitems.name: items.data.textColor

classitems.description: If true and the character is talking with a voice associated, the voice-sound will be analyzed in real-time and the character talk-animation will only be played with the voice-volume is greater or equal to the vn.CharacterDataRecordDocument.items.data.talkingVolume value. In case of Live2D character the openess of the mouth is associated with the talking volume. The louder the voice is the more open is the mouth of the Live2D character.
classitems.name: items.data.timeTalkingToVoiceVolume

classitems.description: If vn.CharacterDataRecordDocument.items.data.timeTalkingToVoiceVolume is set to true this property defines the talking-volume (0 - 100) which must be reached before it counts as "talking". The default-value is 5 to ignore background noise.
classitems.name: items.data.talkingVolume

classitems.description: Contains all images used for the Idle-Animation of the character.
classitems.name: items.data.idle

classitems.description: Contains all images used for the Talking-Animation of the character.
classitems.name: items.data.talking

classitems.description: The idle-animation speed.
classitems.name: items.data.idleSpeed

classitems.description: The talking-animation speed.
classitems.name: items.data.talkingSpeed

classitems.description: Defines the time-range in which the idle-animation is played.
classitems.name: items.data.idleTime

classitems.description: Indiciates if the CG Gallery entry is listed or hidden.
classitems.name: items.data.listed

classitems.description: Indiciates if the CG Gallery entry is locked by default or not.
classitems.name: items.data.locked

classitems.description: The image of the CG Gallery entry.
classitems.name: items.data.graphic

classitems.description: The thumbnail image of the CG Gallery entry.
classitems.name: items.data.thumb

classitems.description: Stores the link to the chapter the CG Gallery entry belongs to.
classitems.name: items.data.relationData

classitems.description: The sprite-sheet image used for the animation.
classitems.name: items.data.graphic

classitems.description: Number of frames the sprite-sheet has on x-axis.
classitems.name: items.data.framesX

classitems.description: Number of frames the sprite-sheet has on y-axis.
classitems.name: items.data.framesY

classitems.description: Indiciates if only specified frame-range is played.
classitems.name: items.data.useFrameRange

classitems.description: Indiciates if another specified frame-range is used if the animation repeats.
classitems.name: items.data.useRepetitionFrameRange

classitems.description: A range to define the start- and end-frame of the animation.
classitems.name: items.data.frameRange

classitems.description: Indicates if the animation is repeats after finish.
classitems.name: items.data.repeat

classitems.description:
The common event's start condition.

  • 0 = Call - Common Event needs to be called by command.
  • 1 = Auto - Common Event runs automatically
classitems.name: items.data.startCondition

classitems.description: Indicates if the common-event runs in parallel.
classitems.name: items.data.parallel

classitems.description: Indicates if a switch needs to be set to ON before the common event will be trigger. That has no effect startCondition is set to "Auto".
classitems.name: items.data.conditionEnabled

classitems.description: Switch to check if items.data.conditionEnabled is set to true.
classitems.name: items.data.conditionSwitch

classitems.description: Contains all commands that will be executed by the common-event.
classitems.name: items.data.commands

classitems.description: Contains all parameter definitions of the common-event.
classitems.name: items.data.parameter

classitems.description: Color 1 which can be used in messages using {C:1} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color1

classitems.description: Color 2 which can be used in messages using {C:2} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color2

classitems.description: Color 3 which can be used in messages using {C:3} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color3

classitems.description: Color 4 which can be used in messages using {C:4} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color4

classitems.description: Color 5 which can be used in messages using {C:5} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color5

classitems.description: Color 6 which can be used in messages using {C:6} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color6

classitems.description: Color 7 which can be used in messages using {C:7} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color7

classitems.description: Color 8 which can be used in messages using {C:8} text-code.
classitems.name: items.data.color8

classitems.description: The game title.
classitems.name: items.data.gameTitle

classitems.description: The game's resolution (height-value like 720p).
classitems.name: items.data.resolution

classitems.description:
The game resolution's aspect ratio if a predefined resolution was selected.

  • 0 = 4 : 3
  • 1 = 16 : 10
  • 2 = 16 : 9
classitems.name: items.data.aspectRatio

classitems.description:
The resolution type selected.

  • 0 = Predefined Resolution
  • 1 = Custom Resolution
classitems.name: items.data.resolutionType

classitems.description: The scene where the game should start.
classitems.name: items.data.startInfo

classitems.description: A document link to the actual scene which should be used as start-scene.
classitems.name: items.data.startInfo.scene

classitems.description: The intro scene which is directly after language selection but before title-screen.
classitems.name: items.data.introInfo

classitems.description: A document link to the actual scene which should be used as intro-scene.
classitems.name: items.data.introInfo.scene

classitems.description: Indicates if an intro scene should be used.
classitems.name: items.data.useIntroScene

classitems.description: Default In-Game UI buzzer sound.
classitems.name: items.data.menuBuzzerSound

classitems.description: Default In-Game UI cancel sound.
classitems.name: items.data.menuCancelSound

classitems.description: Default In-Game UI select sound.
classitems.name: items.data.menuSelectSound

classitems.description: Text which is displayed to the user in auto-generated UI form.
classitems.name: label

classitems.description:
The parameter type.

  • 0 = Text
  • 1 = Number
  • 2 = Switch
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Stores a number list if "Number List" is selected as numberValueType.
classitems.name: numberList

classitems.description:
If type is "Number" it describes which kind of number value is stored.

  • number - A regular number value
  • numberList - A value from a popup-list
  • characters - A character id
  • characterExpressions - A character expression id
  • cgGallery - A CG Galler entry id
  • commonEvents - A common event id
  • animations - An animation id
classitems.name: numberValueType

classitems.description:
If type is "Text" it describes which kind of text value is stored.

  • text - A regular text value
  • sceneId - The UID of a scene.
  • Graphics/Characters - The name of a graphic resource from Graphics/Characters folder
  • Graphics/Backgrounds - The name of a graphic resource from Graphics/Backgrounds folder
  • Graphics/Pictures - The name of a graphic resource from Graphics/Pictures folder
  • Graphics/Transitions - The name of a graphic resource from Graphics/Transitions folder
  • Graphics/Fonts - The name of a font resource from Graphics/Fonts folder
  • Audio/Sounds - The name of an audio resource from Audio/Sounds folder
  • Audio/Music - The name of an audio resource from Audio/Music folder
  • Movies - The name of an video resource from Movies folder
  • Live2D - The name of an Live2D resource from Live2D folder
classitems.name: stringValueType

classitems.description: Stores number-variable if type is "Number"
classitems.name: numberVariable

classitems.description: Stores string-variable if type is "Text"
classitems.name: stringVariable

classitems.description: Stores boolean-variable if type is "Switch"
classitems.name: booleanVariable

classitems.description: Stores the name:number pairs.
classitems.name: entries

classitems.description: The display name of the number-entry.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The actual number value which is stored if that number-entry is selected.
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Stores a document-link to the chapter the CG Gallery entry belongs to.
classitems.name: chapter

classitems.description: The UID of the document to link to.
classitems.name: uid

classitems.description: Display name of the link.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The start-value.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: The end-value.
classitems.name: end

classitems.description: The red-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: red

classitems.description: The green-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: green

classitems.description: The blue-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: blue

classitems.description: The alpha-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: alpha

classitems.description: The red-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: red

classitems.description: The green-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: green

classitems.description: The blue-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: blue

classitems.description: The grey-value (0 - 255).
classitems.name: grey

classitems.description: The actual resource.
classitems.name: resource

classitems.description: The resource name.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The HUE (0 - 359) of the image. Has no effect in current version.
classitems.name: hue

classitems.description: The tone of the image. Has no effect in current version.
classitems.name: tone

classitems.description: The opacity of the image. Has no effect in current version.
classitems.name: opacity

classitems.description: The blending-mode used if the image is rendered. Has no effect in current version.
classitems.name: blending

classitems.description: The audio volume in percentage (0 - 100).
classitems.name: volume

classitems.description: The audio playbackRate in percentage.
classitems.name: playbackRate

classitems.description: Identifier for the command so the command interpreter can recognize how to interpret this command.
classitems.name: id

classitems.description: Unique Identifier (UID) of the command. That UID is necessary for certain multi-language features.
classitems.name: uid

classitems.description: Indentation level
classitems.name: indent

classitems.description: Indicates if the command is expanded in scene editor or not.
classitems.name: expanded

classitems.description: Stores the command-specific data. See Scene Commands in Extension-Editor for more information about which command saves what kind of specific data.
classitems.name: params

classitems.description: The variable's display name.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
The variable's scope.

  • 0 = Local Variable
  • 1 = Global Variable
  • 2 = Persistent Variable
classitems.name: scope

classitems.description: The variable's index. Means which variable is this. So index 0 = Variable 0001, 1 = Variable 0002, etc.
classitems.name: index

classitems.description: UID of the string to link to.
classitems.name: lcId

classitems.description: If the string doesn't exist the default text is used.
classitems.name: defaultText

classitems.description: The "t" stands for "text" and stores the default text used if no external string or translation can be found.
classitems.name: t

classitems.description: The "d" stands for "data" and stores additional data for the string. Can be empty.
classitems.name: d

classitems.description: The ID of the character who is the speaker of this text.
classitems.name: d.cid

classitems.description: The Command Entry-ID (UID) of the scene command this text belongs too.
classitems.name: d.eid
